**Resources for discussion**

[The age of de-skilling](https://infoweb.newsbank.com/apps/news/document-view?p=NewsBank&t=pubname%3AANA2W%21Atlantic%253A%2BWeb%2BEdition%2BArticles%2B%2528USA%2529/year%3A2025%212025/mody%3A1026%21October%2B26&action=browse&year=2025&format=text&docref=news/1A3FC2862E610C00) - article by Kwaime Anthony Appiah published in web edition of the *Atlantic*

[The people outsourcing their thinking to AI](https://infoweb.newsbank.com/apps/news/openurl?ctx_ver=z39.88-2004&rft_id=info%3Asid/infoweb.newsbank.com&svc_dat=NewsBank&req_dat=C8AE3582ADFA449FA0E0874A2C7B1E7E&rft_val_format=info%3Aofi/fmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Actx&rft_dat=document_id%3Anews%252F1A4BA34541530128) - article by Lila Shroff published in web edition of the *Atlantic*

[The cognitive paradox of AI in education: Between enhancement and erosion](https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/psychology/articles/10.3389/fpsyg.2025.1550621/full) - opinion article by Jose et al. from *Frontiers in Psychology*

**Learn more**

[How AI could save (not destroy) education](https://www.ted.com/talks/sal_khan_how_ai_could_save_not_destroy_education) - Ted Talk by Sal Kahn (founder and CEO of Khan Academy)

[Generative AI without guardrails can harm learning: Evidence from high school mathematics](https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2422633122) - by Bastani and Sungu (2025) from *PNAS*

[The widening gap: The benefits and harms of generative AI for novice programmers](https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3632620.3671116) - a research article by Prather et al. from *ICER '24: Proceedings of the 2024 ACM Conference on International Computing Education Research*.

[The impact of generative AI on critical thinking: Self-reported reductions in cognitive effort and confidence effects from a survey of knowledge workers](https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3706598.3713778) - a research article by Lee et al. from *CHI '25: Proceedings of the 2025 CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems*

**Learn more**

[*Generative AI enhances individual creativity but reduces the collective diversity of novel content*](https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/sciadv.adn5290) - research article by Doshi & Hauser in *Science Advances*

[*Homogenizing effect of large language models (LLMs) on creative diversity*](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S294988212500091X) - research article in *Computers in Human Behavior* analyzing 2,200 college essays
